TopicTitle: will my ships work in stock? (intake build aid)

Articles.Content: Just as the title says, iive made ssto's, and they required using this mod to reassign the intakes evenly beacsue of serious asymmetric flameouts. (seriously why doesn't ksp do this by default!) Anyway, I wondered if they will still fly without assymetric flameout in a totally unmodded install, if the intakes would stay arranged properly because I want to share these crafts in the spacecraft exchange. Amd would like them to work for everyone just as they work for me. Thanks in advance.
As far as I can tell this has been fixed in stock for 1.0.2. That is, you no longer need to "arrange" the intakes and engines, they will always flame out at the same time when the air runs out.

> 
> As far as I can tell this has been fixed in stock for 1.0.2. That is, you no longer need to "arrange" the intakes and engines, they will always flame out at the same time when the air runs out.

Unfortunately this is not true. Asymmetric flame-outs still happen.

Intake Build Aid just reorders the parts in the .craft file, still 100% stock compatible.

And yes, still necessary.

thanks crown, i swear you know the answers to all of my questions XD aslo yeah, intake build aid is one of those "quality of life mods i cant do without. also KER. love me some twr and delta v readouts.
